text:
Thanks to everyone that said hi! i've been using HubSpot's Designer tools for a while (for landing pages and email templates), but am currently digging into using HubSpot CMS for full website builds. I've worked fairly extensively with Timber in WordPress and Twig in Craft CMS (as well as using templating languages in JavaScript), but I'm still trying to get my head around appropriate architectures for a fully fledged HubSpot site at the moment.

Has anyone got any top tips or "aha" moments will make wading through the docs a bit easier?
and has anyone got any good examples of personalised / dynamic content they could share?

Hi all! Anybody know if it's possible to set up a flexible pattern redirect that includes a query string? I.e redirecting
`<http://www.example.com/assets/docs/file.doc?file-id=xx&auto=1|www.example.com/assets/docs/file.doc?file-id=xx&auto=1>`
using something like this:
`<http://files.example.com/assets/*rest-of-url?:file-name|files.example.com/assets/*rest-of-url?:file-name>`

HubSpot has a couple of free templates in the marketplace that I dug into when first starting out. Gave me a good idea. I kinda combined a few wordpress arch techniques with theirs – especially when the new DM rolled out

Here’s my go to folder structure:
```
code
-css
-js
-hubl [macros and theme variables]

globals

modules

templates [coded and drag/drop templates go here]
-template_partials
```
All of that goes in a parent project folder
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/how-do-i-set-up-a-flexible-pattern-url-mapping>

Hi Team!

Question. I'm submitting a custom form on a landing page (to control the destination page) and we're sending the token, HubSpot page URI, Page name along with the contact details.

I see the submissions in HubSpot on the form, but not on the landing pages. Any Ideas?
cc: <@U504BHZ6K> :point_up::skin-tone-4:

We are using this endpoint:
<https://api.hsforms.com/submissions/v3/integration/submit/:portalId/:formGuid>
Sample embed code?
if it is 100% custom form. the form tag and js using for submit would be better
Its using the API so no embed code
ok. the api itself doesnt redirect the page.
But would it count as a conversion if we identified the page uri?
can we add this person on HubSpot Developer slack @admin pls <mailto:danish@webdew.com|danish@webdew.com>
yes we can
how pls add him
okay sent
ok thanks
once done let me know pls
already sent invitation, he will receive invitation mail shortly
are already you have sent him request
ok

people can also request an invite through <https://designers.HubSpot.com/slack>

The HS team is pretty quick at adding people.
by conversion you mean create a contact record?
Page analytics are not recording it as a submission
herm..
is it an existing Form?
what i mean is the equivilant form in HubSpot?
no, it's not a HubSpot form
but a custom search form (for a results page) that asks for contact information
what i mean is the equivilant form in HubSpot?
from there it redirects to the search, but captures the contact (and hopefully the conversion)
yes
What’s missing here is the internal page id where the submission takes place
what would we call that?
`pageName`

It’s not an officially support solution so I’m not exactly sure where to put it in the your form submission call, but if you look at a native form on a landing page, you should be able to use that as an example
they are using this API.. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3>
based on a normal embedded form it looks like: "pageId":"xxxxxxx",
yeah I would try that, no guarantees on it since it’s not documented but that’s your best bet
Based on my previous use of this i didnt need that id.. but try it and see what happens.
<@U22PNRAJD> any ideas... Looks like a hole in the documentation...

question on the form module and the follow up email. We have built out an email that was set as an automated email but for some reason, its not showing up in the list for "select an email for followup" is there another way we have to do this? Just create straight from the form modules "create" button?

Hey <@U2H3TT8F2> this is because emails for automation (that can be used in Workflows) are separate from form follow up emails. This is due to the fact that some people can send a form follow up email but don’t have access to workflows ( legacy Basic customers and stand alone CMS customers at this point)
Ah ok, so you can only create the follow up from the form module correct?
Correct (I’m noting this down in our systems as  not-great experience we should fix)
sounds good, thanks Zack!

I like your style with this workaround. I'd be curious to know if it works out. Might have been drawing at straws with the CTA image/tracking theory, but I think that's how they're tracked in emails at least.
Does anyone know if it's possible to use HubSpot search to only search blog posts, and not the entire site?
Yes you can use any filter here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/content/search-for-content>

so for `/blog` prefix it would be: `{% module_block module "module_1520438259515148" module_id=2712622, overrideable=true, per_widget_wrapper_html='', placeholder='Search Vision Critical', widget_name='Search Field', wrapping_html='', no_wrapper=True, pathPrefix='/blog' label='Site Search Input' %}` ?
If you want all blog posts under a domain, I would use `type=BLOG_POST`
You would have to clone the site search input module
There are instructions in the module on how to add filteres
Awesome.  Thanks so much Matt
So in "website > pages > templates" im getting an error regarding the use of `<noscript>` tags
any ideas?
it's odd, if i remove it, no issues, but just that tag is having issues. which means I cant use the google conversion code :weary:
<@U22PJPGK0> any ideas on this as its a roadblock for me adding new code to the site?
you cant have no script tags in the header
they are in the header?
Yea, not sure who placed it there (this was a former employee i believe) but we didnt have the issue when he did it originally
wouldn’t be surprised if that’s invalid html. I think `<noscript>` is meant for display - you see that if the code doesn’t run.
truth, i think the person who added it before just did a copy paste from whatever google said and didnt know better
my guess is he also added it there when it only needed to be on one page... :man-facepalming: ugh #WhenMarketersGoRouge

I have a marketer going rogue right now.

provided no information, no designs, no site structure, basically skipped every step of the work before the actual build out but wants client to have a site where they can customize every aspect of it themselves.

Oh and he has a meeting with the client tomorrow to show off everything. Us developers over here are like, this is gonna blow up in his face, and he’s not letting us tell him that before it happens
yikes!
Thats a great way to shorten your career
yea I’m honestly baffled.
I thought over-promise, under-deliver was a best-practice?
hahaha
#dyslexic
yea :crossed_fingers:  that  this doesn’t ruin the rest of my week.
Not dyslexic, I just #disrupted disrupted that best-practice
#disrupt
the title of that image also baffles me lol

<@U2H3TT8F2> All the <noscript> tags should be added to the footer.

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/how-do-i-add-the-google-tag-manager-code-to-my-HubSpot-pages>
Thanks for this, I just ended up removing it as we didnt need it anymore
that or be added in a custom html/HubL module in the bottom of template
No worries
For future refs :slightly_smiling_face:
i was looking for dragonis burning the lanister army.. but i got this instead
Mr. Burns is pretty close to a Lanister
He looks likes the Lanister Patriarch
#mrburns
hahaha
weird, looks like an issue for <#C960Q64G4|design-manager>
Wait. That dragon is named… Dragonis?
Thanks <@UBDMV6Y9Y> using `/designs` exclusively then!
Has anyone successfully put their HubSpot CMS site behind a reverse proxy? This is a completely unsupported configuration, but I’m curious if anyone has done it and hasn’t had any problems.
I had looked into it maybe a year ago and there was no way. Not sure if anything has changed.
haven’t done it but I think smartling the translation service does this

From Derek Gervais on the forums
“I don’t have much to add here outside of the response you’ve gotten from HubSpot already, but I figured I’d jump in just to reiterate that a reverse proxy isn’t supported, and can compromise the performance/security of the HubSpot CMS. You’ll likely run into blocking issues with the HubSpot firewall/DDoS protections if you decide to go down this route.”
Yes, I probably wrote that, but I’m curious if anyone has done it anyway and lived to tell the tale. :slightly_smiling_face:
Ah Jeff you’re working at HubSpot, I’m a moron.
I’m interested in WHY you’re interested <@U22PJPGK0> lol
Anyone who answers yes = instaban
hahaha
I promise amnesty for anyone who says yes. I’m just curious if anyone actually made it work.
looks like you probably successfully scared us away from doing it
I know some customers who have tried and failed but there are probably others out there that we don’t know about.
Anyone try to add a |random to a custom module field loop and get it to work..
Feel like I’m missing something pretty basic here
there no easy way to convert a local module to a global module to use smart content right? You need to rebuild it?
in the design manager in a template you just right click it and convert to global
not sure if you can convert to global using a coded template but you could just have a dummy drag n drop for this
I think you're confusing for groups?
This is what I have
oops that's the global one already
<https://spin.d.pr/QlEorh+>
sorry not a right click, you click and it’s in the inspector panel under more(see screenshot above)
oh man that was hidden, cheers!

Has anyone here used the Sahara template?
I'm trying to edit the video player to play inline when clicked rather than expand and then having to click play again.
